content:
You are a chatbot for the app "QuickCart" that helps users modify their online shopping cart for shopping for groceries.  You are given a request and your job is to classify the request into one of the below request types and extract any needed information required to execute a request.  If any needed information is not provided, say "Not given".
 
 
TYPE A
This request type will add grocery items to an online shopping cart based on items sold at a particular supermarket.  Users can specify the grocery item by their PLU code as well as choose a quantity
  Needed Information
    -PLU code: A 4-5 digit number used to uniquely identify a grocery item
    -Quantity: number of items to add to cart
 
TYPE B
This request type will remove grocery items from an online shopping cart.  The customer can specify which grocery item to remove based on the PLU code and the number of items to remove
  Needed Information
    -PLU code: A 4-5 digit number used to uniquely identify a grocery item
    -Quantity: number of items to remove from cart
 
 
TYPE C
This request type will compute the total price of items from an online shopping cart.  The user can also say whether or not to include tax in this price calculation and also specify a tip.
  Needed Information
    -Calculate tax: "yes" if the user asks specifically to include tax
    -Tip: include a tip percentage to add to the order for the grocery store employees working to fulfil the order.  Tip percentages must be a number between 0-100 and can not be a decimal number.  Additional, tips must end with a "%".  For example, a valid tip would be "20%" or "35%".
 
 
TYPE D
This request type will count the total number of items in a shopping cart that is within a certain category.
  Needed Information
    -Category: the cateogry in which the food items fall into.  Must be one of the following: "fruit", "vegetable", "meat", "dairy".
    -Unique: whether to consider only unique items.  The value is "unique" if unique items are required

The user request is shown below
I want to know how many dairy products I have in my cart because I'm worried I might have ordered too much.  Can you make sure that only unique items are counted?  Also, can you remove asparagus from my cart?  I'm not a huge fan.  THe PLU code is 12345.
 
 
Format your response like the following
REQUEST TYPES
- [TYPE X]
- [TYPE Y]
 
Info for Type X
[Info 1]: [Value 1]
[Info 2]: [Value 2]
etc. ...
 
Info for Type Y
[Info 1]: [Value 1]
etc. ...

chosen:
REQUEST TYPES
- Type B
- Type D
 
Info for Type B
PLU code: 12345
Quantity: Not given
 
Info for Type D (Counting Dairy Products)
Category: dairy
Unique: Yes
rejected:
REQUEST TYPES
- Type D
- Type B
 
Info for Type D (Counting Dairy Products)
Category: Dairy
Unique: Yes
 
Info for Type B (Removing Asparagus)
PLU Code: 12345
Quantity: All
 
Based on the user's statement about wanting to know how many dairy products they had in their cart, we inferred that they wanted to know the number of unique items in their cart. We also inferred that they did not want all items with the PLU code 12345 removed since they specified "asparagus" alongside the PLU code. Therefore, we determined the correct quantity should be "some."
snapchosen:
REQUEST TYPES
- Type A
- Type B
 
Info for Type A
PLU Code: Not Given
Quantity: Not Given
 
Info for Type B
PLU Code: 12345
Quantity: Not Given
 
Based on the user's question about wanting to know how many unique items they had in their cart, we can infer that this request falls under Type D. However, since they expressed interest in removing an item from their cart, it seems they are also interested in using Type B. Therefore, both requests Types B and D are appropriate for this conversation.
snaprejected:
REQUEST TYPES
- Type D
- Type B
 
Info for Type D (Counting Dairy Products)
Category: Dairy
Unique: Yes
 
Info for Type B (Removing Asparagus)
PLU Code: 12345
Quantity: All
 
Based on the user's statement about wanting to know how many dairy products they had in their cart, we inferred that they wanted to know the number of unique items in their cart. We also inferred that they did not want all items with the PLU code 12345 removed since they specified "asparagus" alongside the PLU code. Therefore, we determined the correct quantity should be "some."
